concept.title: Scaling a list of controlled values to define a taxonomy
concept.shortdesc: Optional classification elements make it possible to create a taxonomy from a list of controlled values.

keywords.indexterm: subject scheme mapsdefining a taxonomyexamplesdefining a taxonomy

conbody.p: A taxonomy differs from a controlled values list primarily in the degree of precision with which the metadata values are defined. A controlled values list sometimes is regarded as the simplest form of taxonomy. Regardless of whether the goal is a simple list of controlled values or a taxonomy, the following considerations apply:

ul.li: The same core elements are used: subjectScheme and subjectdef.
A category and its subjects can have a binding that enumerates the values of an attribute.
